pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:0.5: 14. The second training rule on loud noises
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were being noisy while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.3: “‘I will not be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.4: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not be noisy.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes loud noises while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.7: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:1.9: The fourth training rule is finished.
